definition: to flaunt/to advertise/to parade/boost/excessive praise

mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units
variant of 榜[bang3]
notice or announcement/list of names/public roll of successful examinees

sentences.english: The newest high-end apartments on Mars are being marketed with a headphone closet.
sentences.chinese: 最新的火星高级公寓都要标榜自己有一个耳机柜。

sentences.english: So, Alexander is putting himself forward as divine.
sentences.chinese: 所以亚历山大标榜自己为神。

sentences.english: He even identified himself, because he started claiming divine status for himself.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至标榜自己，自称为神。

sentences.english: Nutra prides itself on its ability to meet consumer expectations and satisfy product demand.
sentences.chinese: 保健品标榜它能够满足消费者的期望和满足产品需求。

sentences.english: Pullover tunic flaunts a point collar and open half placket.
sentences.chinese: 套衫中山装标榜点衣领和开半门襟。

sentences.english: Africom innocuously brands itself as "advising and training" military forces.
sentences.chinese: 非洲司令部无害地标榜自己为“资讯和培训”的军队。

sentences.english: Mary was always holding up her children as paragons of good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽老是标榜自己的孩子是品行端正的典范。

sentences.english: YUAN Zhen gave definition of erotic poetry.
sentences.chinese: 元稹自叙“艳诗”定义，以“干教化”相标榜。

sentences.english: She was always holding up her children as paragons of good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽老是标榜自己的孩子是品行端正的典范。

sentences.english: And yet, we are also labelled a bad food nation.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，我们还被标榜为名不副实的饮食之国。

sentences.english: She was always holding up her children as paragons of good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 她总是标榜自己的孩子是品行端正的典范。

sentences.english: Gorgeous empire gown flaunts a wrap - style bodice and drawstring tie.
sentences.chinese: 华丽的礼服帝国标榜一包式胸衣和束带配合。

sentences.english: But on a resume, it's okay to brag.
sentences.chinese: 但是在简历里面，自我标榜是可以接受的。

sentences.english: At a time when the nation is obsessed with sloganeering about honesty … dishonesty is still a plague.
sentences.chinese: 在全国都在标榜诚信的时候，不诚信仍然比比皆是。

sentences.english: The matching set of pierced earrings also flaunt 2 brilliant-cut clear crystals.
sentences.chinese: 匹配的一套穿耳环也标榜二辉煌的切明确的晶体。

sentences.english: Self-praise is felt to be ill-bred.
sentences.chinese: 自我标榜会被认为没有教养。

definition: to pose as/to flaunt oneself as/to boast of/to brag
to agitate for/to enthusiastically promote
to proclaim/to make public or well known
to consider oneself as/to believe oneself to be
to belittle/to disparage/to play down/to demean/to degrade/to devalue
to flatter/to laud sb's accomplishments/adulation
to attack (verbally or in writing)
political correctness/politically correct
to cater to/to pander to
amusing speech or act/jokes/antics/funny/amusing/Taiwan pr. [xue1 tou2]
sensationalism/vulgar claptrap to please the crowds/playing to the gallery/demagogy
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
to pursue (a goal etc) stubbornly/to seek after/to woo
to brag
to esteem/to think highly of/to accord importance to/to revere
to label/to call
